text.base: The iron gate hangs off one hinge, twisted outwardâ€”as if something large forced its way *out*, not in. To the south, the safety of the paved road. To the north, the trees swallow the light, ancient and patient.

lens.believer: The gate wasn't broken by force; it was dissolved. The iron is pitted with corrosion patterns that look like fingerprints. The woods breathe, a slow, heavy rhythm that matches your own pulse.
lens.skeptic: Impact deformity on the gate indicates localized force application exceeding 40,000 PSI. Likely heavy machinery or a vehicle collision, though the lack of paint transfer is anomalous. The forest density is high; visibility is less than 20 meters.
lens.haunted: You know this gate. You used to dare each other to touch it. It's colder now than it was then. Crossing this threshold was the first mistake. Coming back is the second.

gate.description: Jagged iron teeth. The metal is cold enough to burn your skin.

interactions.touch: You press your gloved hand to the metal. It hums, a low-frequency vibration that rattles your teeth.

map.description: The plexiglass case is shattered. The map underneath has been selectively burned. 'KALTVIK' is circled in what looks like black grease marker.

board_updates.label: Twisted Gate
board_updates.description: The iron gate at the trailhead was forced open from the inside.

choices.label: Cross the threshold into the woods

on_success.text: Under a shard of plexiglass, you find a sticker: 'PROPERTY OF [REDACTED] GEOLOGICAL SURVEY'. The date is from next year.

on_fail.text: It's just vandalism. Teenagers and lighters.
